name: Esglesia de l'hospital de la Santa Creu i Santa Pau

reviews.text:
So in most guide books, the Hospital Santa Pau is not really played up. In Rick Steves it is almost a footnote! We spent nearly 3 hours touring this architectural gem! This is one of the most unique and well thought out public buildings of the 19th and early 20th centuries. The audio-tour is both audio and visual as your audio box is also a mini TV with fantastic early photos and construction photos. 

You are really cheating yourself if you do not take this tour!

I cannot even conceive any country anywhere in the world building such a magnificent hospital for the common people. The architect was a visionary and the design was beautiful. A special highlight was the boardroom and the magnificent warm colours throughout. Well worth seeing
From the Sagrada Famiglia head up Avenue Gaudi to the grounds of Santa Creu e San Pau, once a hospital. A gem designed by Montaner in Art Nouveu style- buildings and gardens are spectacular.
